body:
I've needed a `SectionWriter` only once or twice in the time that I've been writing Go. I've also only needed to use `SectionReader` about the same amount. They have use, but are probably not widely useful enough to be in the standard library. It wasn't particularly hard implementing `SectionWriter` myself, though.

Also, the argument for symmetry can go both ways. That is, it could be argued that we should remove `SectionReader` to keep it symmetrical. Compatibility agreement aside, I would actually vote to remove `SectionReader`.
